result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon A Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay any restitution owed - held open for 60 days for State to determine amount - the defendant will then have 30 days after receipt of restitution request to dispute the amount

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

No Contact with E.W., K.H.O., M.W. or M.S. except for divorce proceedings
.

Sex Offender evaluation has already been done but the defendant is to comply with treatment recommendations made

The DOC is to complete a risk needs evaluation and if they feel the assessment warrants a chemical dependency evaluation, the defendant is to comply with any recommendation and with any treatment required

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond of $2500 is applied to Restitution & Court financial obligations owed - cash bond to be held until restitution amount is determined

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 139 days in 15CF507 and 54 days in 16CM887

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Last 30 days to be served on house arrest through GPS and the balance to be served without release. Good time to be allocated proportionately between house arrest & confinement but credit to go toward confinement portion.

State by Lawrence & Gruenke /  Def w/ Atty James Koby
CRT:  this had been scheduled for plea - I had also rec'd letter from ADA Lawrence about new case 16CM887
Lawrence:  yes - new case is part of plea agreement - we were unable to cntact victims about today so are not in victim compliance
Koby:  we are ready to proceed but understand victims entitled to be here 
Lawrence:  victims req to be notified of all events
Koby:  Negotiated Plea filed by Koby - this indicates victim & mother have consulted & approved of plea
Lawrence:  that's correct but I don't know if they want to speak @ Sentencing
Gruenke:  they said they may want to speak @ sentencing - we called & left msgs but haven't heard back...
CRT:  I don't know tht I could go ahead w/ sentencing arguments - just to ensure compliance w/ victim rights act it makes sence to adjourn plea & seh - try to find time next week
Koby:  scheduled for 1:15 on Wed. already...
CRT:  i think you can send written Notice - they should get that hy Mon or Tues & then if you follow-up w/ phone I'll find State has complied - we'll plan on going ahead w/ plea next Wed
CRT:  rec'd letter from ADA Lawrence on 715, not clear if purpose of that was to advise CRT of anything in particular
Lawrence:  just wanted to put issues on record
CRT:  are there other charges you're contemplating?
Lawrence:  deosn't know - we are looking further at computer

2:38 PM - Def in court w/ Atty James R. Koby.  Def in custody.  Noel A. Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
KOBY: he was taken into custody on a PO warrant based on him  allegedly violating the NC order. The hold has been lifted but there is a probation sanction order for him to sit 45 days. LAWRENCE: I have no further info. CRT: You should have reported back after release from hosp. There were issues in wanting to relieved of some of those consequences. When he's released he is to resume EM and report to JSS

Jury trial on July 28, 2016 at 08:45 am.

from Atty James Koby   re: Plea Hrg set for 3-7-16.  Req to set STC - there have been no plea discussions
Per SLH:  3-7-16 can be used as scheduling conference

2:33 PM - No appearance by Def - Atty James R. Koby present.  Noel Ann Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
KOBY: it was either est for trial or do a plea. We had a probation rev  and the probation was denied. No plea discussions and no witness lists from the state. The revocation issue was if the 13 yr old victim would testify. ALJ ordered the victim to appear and the department didn't produce the victim and the decision was in favor of Mr. Steele. If the victim will be called as a witness then I am fine but if not I will file a mtn. LAWRENCE; there was a video of the forensic interview and if so I will file a ntc and the child will then be available for cross as required by statute. CRT: the child is 13 and has to make add' findings. KOBY: in my absence there was a bunch of JSS activity. I was notified by mail that he's in the hosp and I suspect for a min of 30 days. LAWRENCE: there are pending charges now. I just got the report today about conduct that happened a month ago. We can set it for trial and if we come to an agmt we can put it on for a plea.
